Event.name: Beat_opponent
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Winner</fen> has victory over an <fen>Loser</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Winner">He</fex> <fex name="Frequency">always</fex> <t>beats</t> <fex name="Loser">me</fex> <fex name="Competition">at chess</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Winner
Arg.definition: <def-root>The individual or individuals who beat the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Score
Arg.definition: <def-root>A quantity whereby progress is measured during the game, and Rank and <fen>Prize</fen>s are awarded to the <fen>Winner</fen> afterward.</def-root>

Arg.name: Margin
Arg.definition: <def-root>The amount by which the <fen>Winner</fen> 's and <fen>Loser</fen> 's <fen>Score</fen>s differ.</def-root>

Arg.name: Rank
Arg.definition: <def-root>The rank (according to <fen>Score</fen>) that a <fen>Winner</fen> acheives.</def-root>

Arg.name: Prize
Arg.definition: <def-root>A socially and/or monetarily significant entity which is given to a <fen>Winner</fen> according to <fen>Score</fen> or <fen>Rank</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An action of the <fen>Winner</fen> or <fen>Loser</fen> that makes the beating event possible.</def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the <fen>Winner</fen> or <fen>Loser</fen> which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of a <fen>Winner</fen> or <fen>Loser</fen> that also affect their action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>When the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory over the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location where the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory <fen>Loser</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Venue
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE is for the named venue of a competition, particularly when the place has been built for the purpose of a competition.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. </def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>The reason why the <fen>Winner</fen> has victory over the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when winning events began to be repeated to when they stopped.</def-root>

Arg.name: Loser
Arg.definition: <def-root>The individual or individuals that get beat by the <fen>Winner</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state of the world when the <fen>Winner</fen> beats the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Re-encoding
Arg.definition: <def-root>The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the <fex name="Re-encoding">Re-encoding</fex>, but not necessarily. </def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state-of-affairs that prevails as a result of the <fen>Winner</fen> beating the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The frame element <fex name="Iterations">Iterations</fex> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times the <fen>Winner</fen> beats the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Communicative_force
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE indicates the <fen>Communicative_force</fen> or authority with which the winning event operates (often denoted by words such as "officially," "formally," "technically," etc.). </def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness, or a description of the state-of-affairs introduced by the winning event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>A qualitative measure of how much the <fen>Winner</fen> beat the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action.</def-root>

Arg.name: Competition
Arg.definition: <def-root>The event in which the <fen>Competition</fen> competes.</def-root>

Arg.name: Frequency
Arg.definition: <def-root>How often the <fen>Winner</fen> beats the <fen>Loser</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: beat.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: win against in a contest

lexUnit.name: demolish.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: wine a game by a large margin

lexUnit.name: prevail.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: come out as winner in a challenging competition

lexUnit.name: defeat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an instance of defeating or being defeated

lexUnit.name: trounce.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: defeat heavily in a contest
